author: alexandair
body:
- [ ] Resolves issue #abcd.
- [ ] Code is [rebased](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/docs/git/README.md#sync-your-local-repo) on `origin/master`.
- [ ] Add tests that fail without your changes.
- [X] Update all relevant [documentation](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/tree/master/docs).

Change "Contribute" to "Contributing" to be consistent with other titles and section titles.

comments.author: andschwa
comments.body:
> change the title of the article

I don't know what this PR does (without checking the changes), so this does not follow the contributing guidelines:

> Add a meaningful title of the PR describing what change you want to check in.

comments.author: alexandair
comments.body: That title is meaningful in my opinion. The change will modify the title. And I added exact change in the description, so you don't need to look at "changed file".

comments.author: andschwa
comments.body:
> Change "Contribute" to "Contributing"

this should be the title of the PR.

comments.author: alexandair
comments.body:
I've changed the title of PR.
Just out of curiosity, what would I do if I changed more than one word in the title?

comments.author: andschwa
comments.body: "Improve Pull Request workflow documentation" etc. Docs are probably the hardest to document in Git well since the changes are self explanatory but not easy to summarize

title: Change "Contribute" to "Contributing"
